formattedAddress: 159 Bridge Park Dr, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
adrFormatAddress: 159 Bridge Park Dr, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA

editorialSummary.text: Scenic spot at ONE°15 Brooklyn Marina serving French-inspired plates with local ingredients.

originalText.text: We’ve been here for drinks once and finally for dinner and can’t say enough good things about this place! It’s location on the water is perfect where you can enjoy a good breeze, a good view and good weather. The inside is also beautiful but we sat outside both times to enjoy the weather. I ordered the Second Spring cocktail (vodka/passionfruit/lime) which was tart and delicious. The burger was excellent, juicy and flavorful with caramelized onions (yum!) and Gouda (so good!). The fries are mostly crispy but there were some softer ones in there as well. The crab cakes were also excellent, with a corn pick that had the perfect amount of jalapeños. The crab cake itself was delicious and had a great crust, and the chipotle sauce on them was the perfect compliment. Overall would highly recommend this spot and we can’t wait to go back!!

originalText.text: We had a private party here for a wedding in our family. Finger food and drinks were ordered. Bar was the best feature. Our DJ made the party fun. The salmon was our favorite snack.

text.text: We had a private party here for a wedding in our family. Finger food and drinks were ordered. Bar was the best feature. Our DJ made the party fun. The salmon was our favorite snack.

originalText.text: Peaceful and pleasant. Don’t let the 4$ fool you. It’s worth the price. I spent $70 and got half dozen oysters, the croque madame and a delicious cocktail. This was the meal I was searching for all morning. I walked up and down the piers and finally decided to come in and it was worth it. I will definitely be back and am so grateful for this peaceful experience. They even charged my phone which was a pleasant surprise.

text.text: Peaceful and pleasant. Don’t let the 4$ fool you. It’s worth the price. I spent $70 and got half dozen oysters, the croque madame and a delicious cocktail. originalText.text:
Decided to check this spot out while in Brooklyn Heights. It was a Friday night , we were seated right away. Got a good view to the city from this restaurant. The waiter was super nice and went over the whole menu and suggested a few items. We went with the Cheese Plate , which had variety of cheeses with jam. Also had the Grilled Calamari as the appetizer. For the main course we had the roasted Crystal Valley chicken and the painted Hills ribeye
, they were both delicious. Presentation was top notch.

Ambiance - 10/10
Service - 10/10
Views - Excellent
WiFi- Not Sure
Large Groups- Yes
Parking - Paid Garage around the corner

Definitely booking a table for July 4th . Best spot to have dinner watching the  fireworks.

originalText.text: Intimate yet social vibe here. A few different elements lavish the place and it all WORKS!!! It's a really nice place. Indoor and outdoor dining. Booths, tables, and lounge area with fireplace. They serve drinks and some creative dishes. I had veggie burger with shoe string fries...I loved it. Cam had grilled chicken salad. Located right by the water with downtown Manhattan/city views. Plenty of walking space. Get your exercise on or exchange pleasantries with that special someone. Super friendly staff. Tell 'em I sent 'cha.
